title: Task 1: Attribute a work of art to a specific culture.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not attribute the work shown to the specific culture from West and Central Asia (500 B.C.E.â€“1980 C.E.) that created it.
Response does accurately attribute the work shown to the specific culture that created it.

title: Task 2: Justify the attribution by explaining similarities with work by a specific culture from the image set.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use one example of specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type by the same specific culture.

Response uses one example of specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type by the same specific culture.

Response uses two examples of specific visual evidenceto justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type by the same specific culture.

title: Task 3: Explain how context influences artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, and/or function in the creation or meaning of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use one example of specific visual or contextual evidence to explain how the work reflects the cultural context in which works of this type were created.
Response uses one example of specific visual or contextual evidence to explain how the work reflects the cultural context in which works of this type were created.
